sources.title: The Seashell and the Clergyman (1928)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. This experimental French film shows both surrealist and expressionist traits, and helped to lay the foundations for what would become French Surrealism in film. It is about a priest who has hallucinations due to his extreme lust of a woman. I have included five existing soundtracks and a subtitle track, though the only title card is at the very start of the film.Â

metadata.Plot: Grappling with his lustful fantasies and impure thoughts about the curvy wife of an elderly general, a tormented young priest, who has taken a vow of celibacy, finds himself unable to suppress his fervent, almost morbid passion. And, hopelessly obsessed with the unattainable object of his desire, more and more, the delusional man of the cloth succumbs to his complex, feverish hallucinations. Now, there is no place to hide. Can the clergyman escape from his inner demons?
metadata.Actors: Alex Allin, Lucien Bataille, Genica Athanasiou
